image.altText: protestors wave flags outside court

props.synopsis: A pro-Palestinian march across the Sydney Harbour Bridge on Sunday will proceed as an authorised event, after a judge declined to make a prohibition order over the rally, as sought by police.

title.children: Breaking: Pro-Palestinian march across Sydney Harbour Bridge allowed to go ahead

image.altText: The president of the United States stands at a microphone and points a finger

props.synopsis: The outcome somewhat took the wind out of the sails of those who have been criticising Australia's prime minister for not getting a meeting with the US president.

title.children: Trump's tariff turmoil highlights the influence of non-trade factors

image.altText: A non-identifiable child playing with toys.

props.synopsis: A 26-year-old man in Sydney charged with 10 counts of child sexual abuse has thrust private equity giant Quadrant into the centre of another national childcare scandal, this time in the booming out-of-school-hours sector.

title.children: Accused childcare paedophile was previously flagged to authorities

image.altText: Three silhouettes are seen against a large windscreen of a an aircraft flying over sprawling settlement.

props.synopsis: ABC journalists have marked the moment a plane bound for Gaza crossed the line from Israeli territory into northern Gaza.

title.children: The ABC can't enter Gaza — but we can describe it from a plane

image.altText: Profile of a tan-coloured handgun with a sight and flashlight affixed on a dark background

props.synopsis: Sig Sauer's P320 pistol has long been plagued by allegations of accidental firings without a trigger pull. The Australian Defence Force is rolling out a version of the handgun to personnel.

title.children: Defence stands by new handgun despite safety concerns

image.altText: A close-up portrait of an Indigenous man with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese is set to outline Labor's Indigenous policy focus in his fourth address to the Garma festival as prime minister.

title.children: Indigenous leader's hope ahead of meeting with PM

image.altText: A shadowed woman standing in the foreground, the ATO website in the background

props.synopsis: Financial counsellors are calling on the tax office to give small businesses and individuals more time to pay tax debts, as the level of money owed sees calls to debt helplines hit unprecedented levels.

title.children: ATO denies 'heavy-handed' tax debt collection as concerns raised

image.altText: A group of children, dressed in black, stand with their arms in the air, surrounded by water mist.

props.synopsis: As the atrocities in Gaza continue, another crisis is enveloping the Middle East — as record heat, drought and wildfires open up another devastating front.

title.children: Ravaged after a 12-day war with Israel, Iran is now closing in on 'day zero'

image.altText: A close up of Donald Trump's face as he looks over his shoulder with a casual expression.

props.synopsis: The US president says nuclear submarines are being repositioned in response to "provocative statements" from Russia's former president, Dmitry Medvedev.

title.children: Trump says he's moving nuclear subs in response to Russian ex-president

image.altText: Education stock image

props.synopsis: When our parliaments, newsrooms, judicial benches and many other institutions all look a certain way, it is clear who is at the centre of Australia's monoculture.

title.children: The cracks are showing in the stories Australia tells itself about multiculturalism

image.altText: Two 20-something women and a middle-aged man hold up a clapper board that says 'Optics'

props.synopsis: We don't want to brag but the ABC has received 44 Logie nominations this year. From deep-dive documentaries to side-splitting comedies, it would be selfish of us not to share these ABC gems for your viewing pleasure.

title.children: From big laughs to bold stories, the ABC's Logie-nominated shows are ready to binge

image.altText: Ghislaine Maxwell faces second week in court

props.synopsis: Ghislaine Maxwell has been transferred to a lower-security prison in Texas to continue serving her 20-year prison sentence for helping Jeffrey Epstein abuse underage girls.

title.children: Ghislaine Maxwell moved from Florida prison to lower-security facility

image.altText: A person wearing blue gloves injects something on a microscope

props.synopsis: The baby boy's father was a toddler when his son's embryo was first created, in an event family members likened to "something from a sci-fi movie".

title.children: Baby born in US from an over‑30‑year‑old embryo breaks record

image.altText: A female student is surrounded by 3 firefighters, one of whom is holding a birthday cake with a lit candle number 22.

props.synopsis: In Indonesia, firefighters do not just battle flames — they pick up school report cards, banish ghosts, and comfort the broken-hearted. But these acts of public service throw a spotlight on other problems.

title.children: Who you gonna call? In Indonesia, firefighters tackle ghosts and broken hearts

image.altText: Former South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol, dressed in a suit, walking with a group

props.synopsis: South Korea's jailed former president, Yoon Suk Yeol, again refuses to attend questioning by investigators, using a new method to resist — taking off his prison uniform and laying down on the floor at his detention room.

title.children: South Korea's ex-president Yoon resists questioning by taking off prison uniform

image.altText: Red lava spews from the top of a volcano, with ash climbing high into the night sky and lightning striking

props.synopsis: It's the second time in less than three months the volcano has erupted.

title.children: Indonesia's Mount Lewotobi Laki-laki erupts

image.altText: Three women pose with medals after a swimming race

props.synopsis: Mollie O'Callaghan has come within 0.12 seconds of becoming Australia's most successful World Championships swimmer of all time, claiming silver in the women's 100m freestyle in Singapore.

title.children: Mollie O'Callaghan falls agonisingly short of record-breaking gold

image.altText: Codelco

props.synopsis: Rescue teams in Chile are working to reach five trapped workers at the world's largest underground copper mine after a tremor caused tunnel collapses.

title.children: Teams race to rescue trapped workers after tremor leaves one dead in Chile

image.altText: A bone and statuette at a shrine in the Tuam graveyard in Ireland

props.synopsis: Two boys found "a jumble of bones", which sparked the discovery and now excavation of a mass grave at a mother-and-baby home run by Catholic nuns.

title.children: Mass graveyard of 800 children being excavated in Ireland

image.altText: A screenshot from the video game Rugby League 26 featuring a player from the NRLW competition.

props.synopsis: After a launch mired by bugs, server outages and criticism around player likenesses, Rugby League 26 video game developer Ross Symons defends his company and says unhappy players "should know better".

title.children: Developer of criticised rugby league video game says unhappy players 'should know better'

image.altText: Labor candidates - mostly in red - standing in front of bushland, with Dean Winter at the centre.

props.synopsis: Two weeks after polling day, vote counting will today decide the final make-up of the Tasmanian parliament — with Labor still very much a chance at snatching power from the Liberals.

title.children: Final seat to be decided in Tasmanian election

image.altText: Photo illustration composite of Sarah Murdoch, Bryan Brown and Peter V'landys in black and white, blue boxes behind them

props.synopsis: Tropfest, once one of Sydney's most beloved artistic institutions, is set to be revived by an unlikely alliance involving Racing NSW boss Peter V'Landys and a member of the Murdoch family.

title.children: Unlikely alliance team up to bring back beloved Tropfest festival

image.altText: A close up of Jactina Allan speaking at a media event.

props.synopsis: Victorians will be able to work at least two days a week from home under the state governments new plan to develop legal protections for employees.

title.children: Victorian government to enshrine working from home rights

image.altText: Bradley John Murdoch found guilty [File photo].

props.synopsis: Before Bradley Murdoch was arrested for English backpacker Peter Falconio's disappearance and the attempted kidnapping of Joanne Lees, the killer faced charges, of which he was acquitted, of raping a woman and her 12-year-old daughter in South Australia. WARNING: This story contains content that some readers may find upsetting.

title.children: Before the Falconio trial, Bradley John Murdoch was accused and acquitted of rape and abduction

image.altText: A close-up shot of a politician speaking to media.

props.synopsis: After politicising the stabbing of a 15-year-old boy at the Darwin Show, the Northern Territory government has battened down the hatches with its rhetoric. The subtext: You're either with us, or against us.

title.children: 'Gutter trash': A government hell-bent on change tears down its critics

image.altText: The entry sign of James Cook University

props.synopsis: James Cook University faces pressure to take disciplinary action against a medical student sentenced for domestic violence assault.

title.children: Uni urged to take action after med student sentenced for DV assault

image.altText: On stage, Hazem Shammas, Arab Australian, 50, and Anthony Taufa, Tongan Australian, early 40s, look concerned in army fatigues.

props.synopsis: Shakespeare's Coriolanus has drawn parallels to Trump. But for its star Hazem Shammas, it has brought up the failures of the arts community in relation to the war in Gaza.

title.children: 'How are we OK with this?' Hazem Shammas on how artists have been silenced

image.altText: A young girl with blonde hair smiles for the camera.

props.synopsis: A new global study has identified a hereditary link associated with stuttering, and experts have said the research will be key to providing early intervention for people who struggle with the condition.

title.children: New research tipped to be 'life-changing' for people who stutter

image.altText: small needles in the skin

props.synopsis: The Health Complaints Commisioner investigates after reports two women were treated for lung damage after receiving a dry needling procedure at a regional Victorian massage clinic.

title.children: Patients treated for lung injuries after dry needling procedure

image.altText: A sign that says no atm in a store

props.synopsis: The move follows an ABC investigation which revealed how ATM companies were fuelling predominantly cash sales of illegal cigarettes by placing their private machines in stores.

title.children: Second ATM supplier pulls machines from suspected illegal cigarette stores

image.altText: British and Irish Lions fan at Melbourne Cricket Ground waving a Welsh flag

props.synopsis: The Wallabies have one last chance to battle the British and Irish Lions, trying to avenge last week's heartbreak and avoid a 3-0 series defeat. Here is what you need to know about the third Test between the Wallabies and the British and Irish Lions.

title.children: Lions vs Wallabies: How to watch, what time is kick-off and who is playing?

image.altText: Kylie Minogue wears gold hotpants & shear top on top of a nightclub bar in 'Spinning Around' music video

props.synopsis: Wondering where your votes wound up after the Hottest 100 of Australian Songs? You'll find what you're looking for in the other big countdown: The Hottest 200 to 101.

title.children: Is this classic the 101st best Australian song of all time?
